title: Understanding Seclusion
text: Seclusion is a method used in mental health settings to manage clients who may pose a danger to themselves or others. It involves confining the client in a specific area.

title: Purpose of Seclusion
text: The primary purpose of seclusion is to ensure the safety of the client and others around them. It is not used as a form of punishment.

hintAnswer: Confining a client in a room from which the client cannot freely exit, used when the client poses an immediate danger to themselves or others
title: Characteristics of Seclusion
text: What are the key characteristics of seclusion?
choices: Confining a client in a room from which the client cannot freely exit, used when the client poses an immediate danger to themselves or others
technique where physical or mechanical means restrict a client’s movement
the structured evaluation of the risk factors associated with a person’s potential for engaging in a $$life-threatening$$ behavior, such as suicide
